alert.note: Alert for Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 7:10PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Douglas and south central Chelan Counties through 745 PM PDT... At 710 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near East Wenatchee Bench, or 7 miles east of Wenatchee, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wenatchee, East Wenatchee, Rock Island, Sunnyslope, East Wenatchee Bench, South Wenatchee, West Wenatchee, and Malaga. This includes U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 118 and 133. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
